page.title: 12Along a Wolverhampton Canal
page.content: We walked along the Wyrley and Essing- ton canal in Wednesfield. We saw reeds in the shallow water and a few lilies in deeper water. We saw many trees in- cluding elder,hawthorn,sycamore and horsechestnut.We saw some minnows,pond- skaters,leeches and watersnails.A water vole was on the other bank,also eight ducklings and their mother.Nettles grew on the sides of buildings and through mud where the towpath had been churned up. Brambles,grass and nettles survive best. Some people throw things into the canal such as trolleys,bottles,a pram,a gate and oil cans.There are signs too that people care for the canal.The cou- ncil has made a small garden from the library to the canal. A bridge has been painted green to match the natural sce- nery. people have put flowers at the bottom of gardens by the canal.The can- al wildlife is very interesting.
